intro: Glaucium refractocarpum, commonly known as the refractocarpum poppy, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known genera like Papaver and Corydalis. Its flowers typically bloom in spring, and the plant produces capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Glaucium refractocarpum is often found in rocky or arid soils, thriving in full sun conditions.
